summary:
I have over 20 years experience as an (lead) Enterprise Architect and interim manager of architecture teams. I have proven expertise in developing long term IT (landscape) architectures, expertise gained from my previous employer Essent and multiple assignments for clients of CGI. I have a broad experience in the Energy & Utilities market. For other markets like Telecom and Banking, I  have proved to be able to apply my experience very fast and easily. 
In particular it is my main motive to make IT vision and IT strategy applicable  to projects in realistic steps but in a pragmatic manner. 
Besides this I have over 25 years experience as an employee at Essent (utility company part of RWE). As an architect I have, in the field of information strategy, given shape and direction to many change projects in the utility market for gas, electricity, telecommunications and oil. In this context, I am also very familiar with SAP, and how SAP fits into the IT landscape.
Ensuring broad-based commitment and support is crucial for me. My strength lies in the discussion and negotiation about complex issues in the areas of IT strategy and architecture for different target groups within an organization. Setting up a relationship based on trust is of paramount importance for me. 
An example for this was my asignment as interim manager leading the Architecture team and the S&I team (IT Strategy & Innovation) of the Dutch Railways (Nederlandse Spoorwegen). In total both teams consists of 22 Enterprise Architects.


Specialties: Interim Management, IT strategy & Enterprise architecture, IS-strategy, Enterprise (business) architecture, Application architecture, Process/data architecture & governance, IT policies, Data Governance, Projectmanagement, Knowledge of Energy, Utilities & Telecommunications and Banking sector
